title: Reeling Raiders fire Kelly amid first year as OC
content: Chip Kelly is out as the offensive coordinator of the Raiders, a decision that came after the team's 24-10 loss to the Browns.

title: Mayfield sprains left shoulder in loss; MRI next
content: Buccaneers QB Baker Mayfield sprained his non-throwing shoulder in Sunday night's 34-7 loss to the Rams and will undergo an MRI on Monday.

title: Sanders shines in first start; Browns mum on QB1
content: Shedeur Sanders became the first Browns quarterback to win his first NFL start since 1995, snapping a 17-game losing streak.

title: Rams take over NFC's top seed; now SB favorites
content: As a result of their 34-7 win over the Buccaneers on Sunday, Matthew Stafford and the 9-2 Rams have the best record in the NFC, and coach Sean McVay said after the win, "I love the way that we've handled a little bit of success."

title: 'No quit': Cowboys flex 'grit' in record-tying rally
content: The Cowboys trailed 21-0 against the Eagles but rallied to win 24-21. The 21-point comeback tied a franchise record.

title: Sources: D-II Eastern New Mexico to hire Briles
content: Art Briles, fired by Baylor in 2016 after a review of the Big 12 school's handling of sexual assault allegations made against several football players, is set to take over as coach at Division II Eastern New Mexico, sources confirmed to ESPN on Sunday.

title: Wings again win WNBA draft lottery, to pick No. 1
content: For the second year in a row, the Dallas Wings will select first in the 2026 WNBA draft after winning the draft lottery Sunday.

title: The main thing to know from every Week 12 game: Rams sit atop NFC after Eagles' meltdown
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions from each game. Here's what we learned from Week 12.

title: UConn's Fudd is new No. 1 as Wings win lottery
content: Azzi Fudd is the new projected No. 1 pick after Dallas won the draft lottery for the second consecutive year.

title: Sizing up the postseason picture, including every bowl matchup, with one week to go
content: While some teams look like CFP locks, there's still a lot to be determined as the regular season winds down.

title: NBA first-month lessons: What we're hearing on all 30 teams
content: Tim Bontemps takes the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, the potential post-Trae Hawks and more first-month standout storylines.

title: How McLaren's microscopic Vegas DQ brought Max Verstappen into the title fight
content: A technical infraction as small as a hair's width saw both McLarens disqualified from Vegas, which has enormous ramifications for F1's title fight.

title: Pete Alonso's three most aggressive suitors so far
content: For a second straight winter, the Mets' franchise home run king is seeking a long-term deal. Where might he land?

title: Eze haunts Spurs as Arsenal make statement of title intent
content: After nearly joining Spurs in the summer, Eberechi Eze savored his first North London derby with Arsenal by netting a hat trick against their rivals.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Which team should take Kenyon Sadiq in April?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 13, including why Kenyon Sadiq is TE1 and whether Utah could have two early-pick OTs.

title: Week 12 winners and losers: Gibbs notches highest score of season, Taylor goes quiet
content: Jahmyr Gibbs, Jaxon Smith-Njigba and Emanuel Wilson led the way with big Week 12 performances, while Jonathan Taylor, Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson and were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Wilson shines as fill-in for Jacobs; Monangai takes over in Bears' backfield
content: Green Bay's Emanuel Wilson proved why it's critical to insure your top RBs by rostering their backup.

title: Browns use Sanders, Garrett to throw Raiders, topping Week 12's petty posts
content: NFL teams remained petty as the calendar nears the holiday week, but one squad took it to another level.

title: The luck pendulum swings back in favor of the Chiefs but away from the spread
content: Kansas City finally won a one-score game for the first time all season, but other teams weren't so lucky.

title: Valimaki wins first PGA Tour title in season finale
content: Sami Valimaki became Finland's first PGA Tour winner on Sunday when he closed with a 4-under 66 for a one-shot victory in the RSM Classic in St. Simons Island, Georgia, the final event of the year which saw hopes rise and fall over the final hour of play.

title: Jeeno Thitikul sets LPGA mark; wins finale, $4M payday
content: Jeeno Thitikul closed with a 4-under 68 to win the CME Group Tour Championship and set the lowest scoring average in LPGA Tour history.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal lead Premier League trio in Yildiz chase
content: Arsenal want to sign Juventus star Kenan Yildiz before other Premier League clubs do. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Did Haney silence critics? No denying stardom of Benavidez, 'Bam'
content: David Benavidez, Devin Haney, Jesse Rodriguez and Abdullah Mason all won on Saturday. Andreas Hale provides takeaways on all four fighters.

title: How new labour laws could hit your take-home salary; impact on PF & gratuity decoded
content: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, mandate basic salary at 50% of CTC, potentially lowering take-home pay as retirement contributions rise. These unified laws aim to simplify compliance and boost worker safeguards. Expect higher provident fund and gratuity payments, impacting immediate earnings while enhancing long-term retirement security for employees.

title: 'FC HQ under attack': 3 killed in suicide bombing at Pak paramilitary facility
content: Gunmen launched an assault on Pakistan paramilitary force headquarters in Peshawar on Monday, with police confirming multiple explosions and an ongoing response. This attack follows a deadly car bombing at similar headquarters in Quetta earlier this year, amid escalating regional tensions and a longstanding insurgency in Balochistan.

title: 'Claimed he had a heart attack': Woman used dupatta to strangle husband; lover on run
content: Vadodara police arrested a 25-year-old woman for allegedly murdering her husband, claiming he died of a heart attack. Her suspicious behavior led to an investigation, revealing a conspiracy with her lover and an accomplice who used her dupatta to strangle the victim. The trio had been planning the murder for three months.

title: ‘Go in debt if you have to’: London-based techie cuts short Delhi visit over toxic air
content: A tech professional's stark warning to leave Delhi due to severe air pollution has sparked a heated online debate. While many agree with his health emergency assessment, others highlight the privilege of relocation, emphasizing the need for systemic solutions. Delhi's air quality remains critically poor, raising questions about the city's livability for millions.

title: Reliance Jio, Airtel complain against Apple, Amazon & more tech firms
content: US tech giants like Apple and Meta are clashing with Indian telecom operators Reliance Jio and Vodafone Idea over the 6 GHz spectrum band. While telcos want it for mobile services, tech firms advocate for Wi-Fi use, citing a lack of readiness for mobile. The debate centers on revenue, fair competition, and India's future digital capacity.

title: Double standards? Perth vs Eden Gardens: The pitch paradox explained
content: The two-day Ashes Test in Perth reignited the long-running debate on pitch standards after 32 wickets fell in 141 overs. Indian players and experts questioned the double standards in global criticism of turning tracks. But unlike the underprepared Eden Gardens surface, the Perth pitch improved with time, offered consistent bounce, and allowed Travis Head’s match-defining century, showing that the collapses were due to skillful bowling rather than an unplayable wicket.

title: 'De facto Chief of Staff': Israel strikes Hezbollah chief with $5m bounty – video
content: Israel has eliminated Hezbollah's de facto chief of staff, Haytham Ali Tabatabai, in an airstrike on Beirut's southern suburbs. The strike killed five and injured 25. Hezbollah confirmed the death of the senior commander, who had risen through the ranks after previous leadership losses. Lebanon condemned the attack, warning of escalation.

title: ‘Miraculous escape’: Major disaster averted at IGIA; Kabul flight lands on runway meant for departures
content: An Afghanistan Ariana flight mistakenly landed on a departure runway at Delhi Airport on Sunday afternoon. The Airbus A310, cleared for runway 29L, touched down on 29R, which is designated for takeoffs. Fortunately, no aircraft was present on the runway at the time, averting a potential disaster. Aviation authorities are investigating the serious incident.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook may not be retiring soon, here’s why
content: Reports on Tim Cook's potential retirement are conflicting, with some suggesting a 2026 departure and John Ternus as a successor. However, Mark Gurman of Bloomberg indicates Cook has no immediate plans to step down.  While a leadership transition is anticipated, it's not imminent, and other executive changes may occur.

title: Navy commissions ‘silent hunter' INS Mahe; all about the anti-submarine warfare vessel
content: India's coastal defence has been significantly bolstered with the commissioning of INS Mahe, the first of eight Mahe-class Anti-Submarine Warfare Shallow Water Crafts. Built by Cochin Shipyard Limited, this indigenous vessel is designed for high-tempo ASW missions and coastal patrol in shallow waters, enhancing India's maritime security capabilities.

title: IND vs SA: Markram takes 'superhuman' flying catch as India collapse worsens - Watch
content: Aiden Markram's spectacular one-handed catch at second slip electrified the stadium in Guwahati, stealing the show as India's batting collapsed against South Africa.  Nitish Kumar Reddy was the victim of the stunning grab, leaving India in deep trouble at 119/6.  Marco Jansen's impressive bowling further pushed India towards a potential follow-on.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to employees in internal memo: Google’s AI success can create…
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential "temporary economic headwinds" but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress and leadership in the AI race. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, highlighting the company's strength and unique challenges.

title: Dhawajarohan ceremony: Ayodhya all decked up for grand flag hoisting; here’s what’s planned
content: Ayodhya prepares for a historic flag hoisting ceremony on Tuesday, marking the completion of the Ram temple construction. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will hoist the sacred flag atop the temple's spire during a specific auspicious time. The event, attended by thousands of guests and spiritual leaders, signifies a new chapter for the temple town.

title: Mutual Fund advisor: Don’t start your SIP until you’ve sorted these basics
content: Investing success hinges on life's readiness, not just fund choices. Before picking mutual funds, secure an emergency fund, obtain adequate health and term insurance, and eliminate high-cost debt. These foundational steps prevent financial ruin during crises, ensuring your investments can grow without disruption. Prioritize these essentials for a robust financial future.

title: ‘Very, very optimistic’: Scott Bessent downplays 2026 recession fears in US economy
content: US treasury secretary Scott Bessent expressed strong optimism for 2026, predicting a strong, noninflationary growth economy driven by President Trump's tariff strategy and new trade agreements. He acknowledged some sectors are struggling but highlighted the "One Big, Beautiful Bill" and falling energy prices to cool inflation, while blaming increased regulation in Democratic states.

title: Cholesterol myth-busted: US cardiologist reveals the truth
content: US cardiologist Dr. Jack Wolfson challenges the notion of 'bad' LDL cholesterol, asserting it's vital for nutrient transport and immune function. He argues plaque buildup stems from inflammation, not LDL itself. Dr. Wolfson advocates for natural methods like sunlight exposure for vitamin D, diet, and stress management over statin drugs for optimal heart health.

title: Russian aerobatic team’s tribute to pilot killed in Tejas crash; video
content: Wing Commander Namansh Syal of the Indian Air Force was honored with a 'Missing Man' maneuver by the Russian Knights aerobatics team following his death in a Tejas fighter jet crash at the Dubai Air Show. The US F-16 team also expressed shock, with some teams canceling performances out of respect for the fallen pilot.

title: India growth outlook: S&P sees 6.5–6.7% expansion ahead; warns about US tariffs
content: India's economy is poised for robust growth, with S&P Global Ratings forecasting 6.5% expansion this fiscal and 6.7% next.  Boosted by tax cuts and monetary easing, consumption is expected to drive growth, offsetting the impact of higher US tariffs.  Strong domestic demand and potential trade agreements with the US are key factors supporting this optimistic outlook.

title: Mandhana's wedding postponed: Muchhal briefly hospitalised; her father remains in ICU
content: In an unexpected turn of events, the joyous wedding festivities for Smriti Mandhana in Sangli were put on hold as her family faced urgent health concerns. Her father, Srinivas Mandhana, showed worrisome symptoms akin to a heart attack, prompting an ICU admission. Meanwhile, her fiancé, Palash Muchhal, battled a viral infection and sought medical care but has since been released.

title: After withholding India’s trophy; Mohsin Naqvi hands Pak Asia Cup crown — Watch
content: Pakistan A clinched the Asia Cup Rising Stars trophy for a record third time, overcoming Bangladesh A in a thrilling Super Over. Despite a shaky start, Pakistan posted 125, with Saad Masood's aggressive 38 proving crucial. Bangladesh fought back but fell short in the Super Over, with Pakistan's bowlers holding their nerve.

title: NIOS issues caution against fake websites, apps; check official notice here
content: The National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS) has issued a public notice warning learners and parents about numerous fake websites, apps, and social media accounts impersonating the institution. These unauthorized platforms aim to mislead users and collect personal information for fraudulent purposes. NIOS emphasizes that all official information is exclusively available on nios.ac.

title: Delhi air pollution protest turns violent: Agitators attack police with ‘pepper spray’; 15 detained
content: Fifteen individuals protesting Delhi's severe pollution were detained at C Hexagon after refusing to disperse. Protesters allegedly used pepper spray on police, causing irritation to several officers who required hospitalization. Legal action is expected against those involved in the incident.

title: 'Does a lot of dishes': Usha Vance reacts to missing ring; addresses online speculation
content: Second Lady Usha Vance clarified speculation surrounding her marriage after being photographed without her wedding ring. A spokesperson attributed the oversight to her busy role as a mother of three, emphasizing no deeper meaning. This follows recent online scrutiny of Vice President JD Vance's interactions at a conservative event and his comments regarding his wife's religious beliefs.

title: Auto sector outlook: Policy tailwinds to spur 2–3 year demand revival
content: India's auto sector anticipates a strong demand surge over the next two to three years, fueled by government initiatives. Reductions in income tax, interest rates, and GST, alongside pay commission revisions, are expected to significantly boost consumer spending power and drive sales growth for vehicle manufacturers.

title: ‘Dreamt of setting up clinic in US’: Hyderabad doc dies after visa denial; note found
content: A 38-year-old doctor in Hyderabad died by suicide after her US visa was rejected, a dream she held to open her own clinic. The incident, which occurred Thursday night, came to light Sunday when her family was alerted. A suicide note cited the visa rejection and a failed marriage proposal as reasons for her extreme step.

title: Stuart breaks silence on 'crying' meme after England’s Ashes collapse: 'Think that was…'
content: Australia secured a commanding 1-0 Ashes lead after England suffered a dramatic batting collapse in Perth. Despite an initial lead, England's middle order faltered, allowing Travis Head's rapid century to seal an eight-wicket victory. Former pacer Stuart Broad's stunned reaction to Joe Root's dismissal went viral, highlighting the Ashes' intense drama.

title: Stephen Curry unveils new poster for upcoming movie with Ayesha Curry
content: Basketball star Stephen Curry is set to debut in the animated movie GOAT. The film features an all-animal world and a young goat's journey in a high-intensity sport. Curry voices a giraffe and relates to the underdog story. The movie, co-produced by his company, also stars his wife Ayesha Curry and other notable actors.

title: Viral 3I/Atlas 'unverified' footage shows unexplained motion in space
content: New videos of interstellar comet 3I ATLAS have ignited public interest. Online discussions suggest the comet might be rotating, with some users sharing comparisons to past images. However, these claims remain unverified by NASA and ESA. Scientists are awaiting high-resolution images to determine if the observed effects are real or imaging artefacts. The comet is currently visible before dawn.

title: Op Crystal Fortress: Rs 262cr meth empire busted in South Delhi mansion; foreign links under scanner
content: Narcotics Control Bureau and Delhi Police seized 329 kg of methamphetamine worth Rs 262 crore in Chattarpur, arresting two individuals. This intelligence-driven operation, codenamed Operation Crystal Fortress, targeted a transnational drug network linked to a foreign kingpin. The seizure highlights the growing challenge of synthetic drugs in India.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 26,100; BSE Sensex up 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday on positive global cues. While Nifty50 was above 26,100, BSE Sensex was up around 100 points.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for the week starting Nov 24 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services has identified Max Healthcare and Reliance Industries as top stock picks for the week of November 24, 2025. Max Healthcare shows robust Q2FY26 performance with strong revenue and EBITDA growth, supported by expansion plans. Reliance Industries reported an operationally in-line 2QFY26, with Retail and RJio driving consolidated EBITDA growth.

title: Goa cop apologises to 2 Russian women after ‘go to your country’ remark
content: Two Russian women, an actress and a DJ, alleged verbal abuse by a policeman during a traffic stop in Mandrem, Goa. The officer reportedly used expletives and told them to leave the country. Mandrem police have since apologized, stating the officer acknowledged his misconduct and will not repeat it. This incident follows other recent reports tarnishing Goa's tourism image.

title: Guru Tegh Bahadur Shaheedi Diwas: Delhi govt declares public holiday on Nov 25
content: Delhi declares November 25 a public holiday for Guru Tegh Bahadur's 350th martyrdom anniversary, with events at Red Fort from Nov 23-25. The holiday aims to honor his legacy of sacrifice and religious freedom. Prime Minister Modi may attend the concluding ceremony, with security heightened due to a recent blast.

title: Smriti Mandhana's wedding postponed: Doctor provides crucial health update on father
content: According to doctors, Mandhana’s father, Srinivas Mandhana, reported symptoms of angina pectoris, a form of chest pain associated with coronary heart disease.  ​​​An ECG was performed, which showed no new concerning findings. However, his blood pressure remained on higher side, prompting doctors to keep him under observation.

title: Asian stocks climb as rate-cut hopes steady markets; crude prices ease
content: Asian markets rallied on hopes of a US interest rate cut, following remarks from a top Fed official suggesting room for adjustment. This optimism countered a dip in oil prices, influenced by potential progress in Russia-Ukraine peace talks. Investors are now keenly awaiting US producer price data for further economic cues.

title: Diamond ring sparks rumours: Is Hardik Pandya engaged? Mahieka Sharma breaks silence
content: Speculation swirled around cricketer Hardik Pandya's engagement after girlfriend Mahieka Sharma sported a diamond ring. Sharma, 24, addressed the rumours on Instagram, humorously dismissing them as a result of her enjoying "nice jewellery." The couple, who have an eight-year age gap, made their first public appearance in October. Pandya was previously married to Natasa Stankovic.

title: Explained: How India’s labour codes will reshape wage, social security
content: India has brought four consolidated Labour Codes into force from 21 November 2025, replacing 29 central labour laws and creating a unified regulatory structure for wages, industrial relations, social security and workplace safety. The overhaul introduces single-point compliance, wider social security coverage, updated wage norms, revised employment definitions and new provisions on documentation, safety and working conditions.

title: 'Abusing Hindus again': BJP hits out at TN deputy CM for calling Sanskrit 'dead language'
content: Tamil Nadu Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin's remarks calling Sanskrit a "dead language" have drawn sharp criticism from the BJP. The party accused Stalin of repeatedly insulting Hindus and promoting division, contrasting him with Prime Minister Modi's "positive politics" aimed at unity and development.

title: Assess ecological implications of proposed elevated corridor in Kaziranga, UNESCO urged
content: A central Assam resident says the UN body should request the governments of India and Assam to suspend the 35.45-km project until a thorough evaluation is completed

title: More Karnataka Congress legislators backing Shivakumar travel to Delhi
content: According to sources, at least six legislators have landed in the national capital on Sunday (November 23) night.

title: Assam approves Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) Policy 2025
content: The decisions aimed at positioning Assam as the leading aviation MRO hub of Northeast India by 2030 and strengthening Assam's education framework

title: TVK leaders ‘Bussy’ Anand, Aadhav Arjuna appear for CBI questioning in Karur stampede case
content: Accompanied by party Karur West district secretary K.P. Mathiyazhagan and functionary M.C. Pounraj, they arrived at the camp office of the CBI team in Karur

title: Congress takes swipe at PM Modi over Rupee's 'freefall'
content: The Rupee had plunged 98 paise to close at its lifetime low of 89.66 against the U.S. dollar on November 21

title: Mushrooming coaching centres: Parliamentary panel to examine trend, existing legislations
content: There have been cases of students enrolled in coaching institutes ending their lives in recent years due to study pressure, with several cases reported in Rajasthan's Kota city alone

title: Where does road dust settle in India’s efforts to clean its air?
content: Dust pollution is mainly caused by unscientific practices during road development and maintenance. The collected dust is typically discarded in landfills or on roadsides, wherefrom the wind easily carries it back into cities, rendering the entire sweeping process ineffective

title: Man sleeping in parked car on ORR charred to death as vehicle catches fire
content: Preliminary findings suggest he pulled over, applied the handbrake and reclined the seat, possibly switching on the heater before falling asleep

title: Who is Justice Surya Kant, the 53rd Chief Justice of India?
content: Justice Surya Kant will remain in the post for nearly 15 months. He will demit office on February 9, 2027 on attaining the age of 65 years

title: Maharashtra Minister’s PA booked for ‘abetting wife’s suicide’
content: “Palve's family has alleged that she took the extreme step following torture and harassment by Mr. Garje and demanded a thorough investigation,” say police

title: Indian Navy commissions indigenous anti-submarine warfare vessel INS Mahe
content: The ship is designed to hunt submarines, conduct coastal patrols, and secure India's vital maritime approaches

title: Three held in Uttarakhand for transporting youngsters to Myanmar to force them into cybercrime
content: Preliminary investigations revealed that Indian agents contacted the victims in person or through mobile applications such as Telegram and WhatsApp, and after extorting money, sent them to Bangkok.

title: Non-government panel’s report on Assam Agitation to be tabled in Assembly, says Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Himanta Sarma claimed that it would be first time a report from a commission formed by non-government agencies would be tabled in the Assembly

title: Sonam Wangchuk's hearing LIVE: SC to hear plea challenging activist’s NSA detention
content: The Supreme Court is scheduled to hear today a plea filed by Sonam Wangchuk's wife which termed the climate activist's detention under the stringent National Security Act as illegal.

title: PM Modi returns from a three-day visit to South Africa
content: At the G20 Leaders Summit, the Prime Minister called for a global compact to prevent misuse of artificial intelligence and made a strong pitch for critical techniques to be human-centric

title: How can State PSCs be reformed? | Explained
content: How did the Montagu Chelmsford report lead to the establishment of present-day  Public Service Commissions? What is the role of the Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions? Is a periodical review of the examination syllabi necessary?

title: Kerala local body polls: Jewellery hub of Koduvally has many Independents in the fray
content: The Indian Union Muslim League stronghold is often in the news for the Communist Party of India (Marxist)’s [CPI(M)] unique experiment of fielding a high number of Independent candidates

title: Kerala local body polls: Human-wildlife conflict emerges as a key poll narrative across forest-fringe regions
content: The issue affects 273 grama panchayats, with 30 of these classified as severe conflict zones, according to a Forest dept. study. While the LDF claims to have taken several steps to mitigate the problem, the UDF and NDA differ and see the Wild Life Protection (Kerala Amendment) Bill, 2025 as a poll ploy

title: Tamil Nadu rains highlights: Several districts announce holidays
content: With the Northeast monsoon intensifying in southern districts, Tenkasi, Tirunelveli, Thoothukudi, and Kanniyakumari districts have been experiencing widespread rainfall

title: Congress will not support four new ‘anti-national’ labour codes: K Muraleedharan slams Centre
content: Mr. Murleedharan claimed that under the new codes, labourers can form an organisation only if at least 10% of its members are part of it; he called this provision incorrect, saying that forming a union is a workers' right.

title: 13 new amphibians recorded from northeast
content: This is the highest number of vertebrate species described in a single publication in over a decade in India

title: Several T.N. districts announce holiday in schools due to rain
content: With the Northeast monsoon intensifying in southern districts, Tenkasi, Tirunelveli, Thoothukudi, and Kanniyakumari districts have been experiencing widespread rainfall

title: What Gen Z is really talking about when they talk politics
content: Among all the Gen Zers this reporter spoke to, one thing was irrefutable: they get their news from social media, absorbing the gist before swiping on. Some, however, do gravitate towards long-form pieces through newspapers and digital subscriptions

title: CM Revanth reviews arrangements for Telangana Rising Global Summit
content: The Chief Minister directs officials to ensure all arrangements meet international standards, stating that the summit will attract delegates from across the world

title: Congress panel consults leaders of TNCC on seat-sharing with DMK
content: AICC in-charge of Tamil Nadu and Puducherry, Girish Chodankar said the meeting was to understand the party’s strength and weaknesses, how to approach the assembly elections and alliance partners.

title: Motorists seek adequate safety measures on new ROB in Ranipet town to prevent accidents
content: Originally given its nod in 2019, the new bridge is jointly done by the Southern Railway and the National Highways (NH) wing of State Highways.

title: Tipra Motha Chief warns Minister amid recent political violence in Tripura
content: Tipra Motha Chief Pradyot Kishore Debbarman accuses a Minister of inciting violence and also “taking money from a vested quarter to divide the indigenous people”

title: Dynasty politics and votes: The family packs of Bihar
content: The Bihar Assembly election threw family members of politicians into the limelight. The sons and daughters of MPs and MLAs say they have been elected based on their potential and their work

title: Indigenous presence stronger in 103 Assembly seats: Assam BJP
content: The party has attributed this to the delimitation exercise of 2023 to ensure political safeguards for the State’s indigenous communities

title: J&K doctors’ bodies condemn blast near Red Fort, terms medics involvement ‘deeply disturbing’
content: The Doctors Association Jammu termed the involvement of doctors in terror as a “complete betrayal of the Hippocratic Oath and an insult to the noble medical profession”

title: Residents call for tighter regulation of waste plants under GRAP norms in Delhi
content: Even during GRAP III restrictions, which curb industrial activity, these waste plants continue operating because they are classified as “essential services”.

title: India, Italy announce joint initiative for co-op in combating financing of terrorism as PM Modi meets Meloni
content: During the meeting on the sidelines of the G20 summit, the two leaders adopted the India-Italy Joint Initiative to Counter Financing of Terrorism, which reiterates their common resolve to fight terrorism

title: Kochi may see more fever casesas weather patterns change
content: A total of 9,848 fever cases were reported in the month up to November 18, 2025, according to Health department statistics

title: "Son Of A Bi**h": How Musharraf Had Reacted To Pak Scientist "Leaking" Nuke Secrets
content: A former American spy revealed Pakistan's then-president, Pervez Musharraf, was furious when confronted with evidence that physicist was selling the country's nuclear secrets abroad.

title: Justice Surya Kant Sworn In As New Chief Justice Of India: 10 Facts
content: Justice Surya Kant, who has been part of various landmark verdicts, took oath as the 53rd Chief Justice of India on Monday. Justice Kant, who succeeded Justice BR Gavai, will serve as the Chief Justice of India for nearly 15 months.

title: FBI Director Kash Patel Faces Scrutiny Over SWAT Protection For Girlfriend
content: FBI Director Kash Patel is facing scrutiny after reports that SWAT agents and other government resources were used to protect his girlfriend, country singer Alexis Wilkins.

title: 15 Arrested For Using Pepper Spray On Delhi Cops During Air Pollution Protest
content: Students detained during demonstrations against rising pollution levels in the Delhi-NCR region were taken to the Parliament Street Police Station, where they are undergoing medical examinations, officials said on Monday.

title: Chief Justice Surya Kant Takes Over. Backlog Mountain Biggest Challenge
content: President Droupadi Murmu administered the oath of office to Justice Surya Kant, who succeeded Justice Bhushan R Gavai.

title: IndiGo Flyer Alleges Luggage Was Cut Open, Items Worth Rs 40,000 Stolen, Airline Responds
content: The Mumbai-based woman expressed disappointment in the airline's lack of accountability, sharing photos of her damaged luggage on LinkedIn.

title: Maharashtra Minister Pankaja Munde's Key Aide Arrested Over Wife's Suicide
content: Anant Garje, the personal assistant to Maharashtra Minister Pankaja Munde, has been arrested by the Worli Police in Mumbai after his wife, Gauri Garje, allegedly died by suicide.

title: "If Mumbai Slips Out Of Hands...":  Raj Thackeray's Warning For Civic Body Polls
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has issued a strong call for vigilance ahead of the crucial Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) polls, and called it the "last crucial election" for the Marathi community.

title: At Least 3 Dead As Gunmen Attack Pakistan Paramilitary Force Headquarters In Peshawar
content: At least three people were killed after gunmen attacked Pakistan's paramilitary force headquarters in Peshawar on Monday.

title: Delhi Air Quality 'Very Poor' At 396, Several Hotspots Breach 400 Mark
content: A thin layer of pollution was seen over the national Capital, with the Air Quality Index (AQI) touching 396 on Monday, firmly in the 'very poor' category.

title: 'Madvi Hidma Amar Rahe' Slogans Raised As Delhi Toxic Air Stir Turns Violent
content: Madvi Hidma, who was responsible for at least 26 armed attacks against security forces and civilians, was killed in an encounter on November 18.

title: Indian Visiting Grandchild In Canada Harasses School Girls, To Be Deported
content: A 51-year-old Indian man, who was visiting Canada on a six-month visitor visa, was convicted of criminally harassing two teenage girls outside their school.

title: Delhi Blast Accused Doctors Were Radicalised During MBBS Course, Internship: Sources
content: Fifteen people were killed and over a dozen left injured when a Hyundai i20 car driven by Umar-un-Nabi, a Kashmiri doctor, exploded near the iconic Red Fort.

title: 74-Year-Old Bengaluru Man Loses Rs 1.33 Crore In Fake IPO Scam
content: Shivakumar, on September 21, filed a complaint saying that Mahesh neither returned the invested money nor provided the promised profits, leading him to realise that he had been defrauded.

title: In His Words: The Evolution Of Trump's Rhetoric About Zelenskyy And Putin
content: Donald Trump said during his White House campaign that if he won the 2024 election, he would be able to end  Russia-Ukraine war in 24 hours. But in 10 months since he took office, the road to peace deal has has been fraught with changing dynamics

title: "Cowardly, Barbaric, Senseless": J&K Medical Bodies Condemn Delhi Terror Attack
content: 15 people were killed and many others injured when a Hyundai i20 car driven by a suicide bomber, Umar un Nabi, a Kashmiri doctor, exploded near the Red Fort.

title: US Woman In 'Slender Man' Stabbing Case Cuts Off Monitoring Device, Goes Missing
content: Morgan Geyser, now 23, admitted to nearly stabbing a classmate to death in 2014 to please the online horror character Slender Man.

title: "That Doesn't Exist": Trump's DOGE Shuts Down With 8 Months Left On Its Charter
content: US President Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency has disbanded with eight months left to its mandate, ending an initiative launched with fanfare as a symbol of Trump's pledge to slash the government's size

title: "Should've Told Us Hosting G20 Is Difficult": South African President To PM Modi
content: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said that his country has learnt a lot from India about hosting the G20.

title: Indian Navy To Commission Indigenous Anti-Submarine Mahe Today
content: The Indian Navy will commission Mahe, the first of the Mahe-class Anti-Submarine Warfare Shallow Water Craft, at the Naval Dockyard in Mumbai on Monday.

title: Rejection of nominations deals a blow to parties in Ernakulam
content: Cong. has taken the biggest hit with 4 of its official candidates losing chance to contest; DCC chief alleges that election officials colluded with ruling LDF to reject the party’s candidates’ nominations

title: U.S. tech majors oppose Indian telcos’ demand to allocate spectrum in 6 GHz band for mobile services
content: The tech majors sought the entire 6GHz band to be allocated for Wi-Fi services instead, as the technical and commercial readiness is not established for mobile services

title: Satish Jarkiholi and Parameshwara send a political message by saying Congress came to power due to team effort
content: In what is being seen as a bid to undermine Deputy Chief Minister and KPCC president D.K Shivakumar, two of his Cabinet colleagues, Satish Jarkiholi and G. Parameshwara on Sunday said that the Congress came to power owing to a team effort

title: How gels and shampoos move: Raman Research Institute builds a device to see it in action
content: This, the Raman Research Institute team explained, matters because many real-world products and industrial chemicals, from oil-recovery fluids to cosmetic gels, belong to a group known as non-Newtonian fluids and unlike water or cooking oil, these materials do not let objects glide smoothly through them.

title: Depression over the Bay likely on November 24, no heavy rainfall warnings for State
content: The IMD forecasts the system may intensify into a cyclone by November 26 but has not specified which coastal States could be affected. Andhra Pradesh currently has no heavy rainfall or fishermen warnings

title: PM Modi departs Johannesburg after concluding his engagements at G-20 Leaders’ Summit
content: Modi on Sunday met his Canadian counterpart Mark Carney, Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi, Italian premier Giorgia Meloni, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa and his counterparts from Jamaica and the Netherlands

title: Opposition demands ECI action against Deputy CM Ajit Pawar’s statement on funds for votes
content: Video of Deputy Chief Minister linking development funds to votes triggers demand for Election Commission intervention

title: Geo TV’s claims on Rafale losses ‘entirely fabricated’: French Navy
content: The French Navy asserted that it had not made any comments on possible Chinese jamming of Indian Rafale jets

title: Bangladesh seeks Hasina’s extradition, sends letter
content: Letter sent to India after International Crimes Tribunal verdict; Dhaka awaits response from Ministry of External Affairs

title: Allay fears of people over SIR, West Bengal Governor tells ECI and State government
content: Ananda Bose’s call comes amid the BJP’s allegation of ‘change of demography’ in border districts due to infiltration from Bangladesh and the Trinamool Congress’s charge that 100-150 voters are being deleted from every booth ‘at the behest of one political party’

title: Presidential Reference opinion does not overrule a judgment, says Justice Gavai
content: Justice Gavai says the Presidential Reference can clarify the law and say a judgment is wrong; he says the court has “only relaxed the timeline... (and) balanced it by saying the Governor cannot sit on a Bill endlessly”

title: Kharge says high command will take decision on leadership
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had met the AICC president on November 22 and it was speculated that D.K. Shivakumar would also meet him, but the meeting didn’t happen

title: Mind your ‘administrative’ language, says Supreme Court report
content: It wants job titles such as Halalkhor, Cycle Sawar, Dhobi, Coolie, Scavenger, Masalchi, Malan, Basta Bardhar, Chowkidar, Bundle lifter be abandoned

title: Sindh will always be a part of India’s civilisational heritage, says Rajnath
content: Mr. Singh recalled the Supreme Court’s 2005 ruling upholding the inclusion of the word Sindh in the national anthem

title: TPCC chief Mahesh Goud donates 11 acres for school, power substation in his native village
content: He participated in the bhoomi puja for a new Durga Devi temple, being constructed by the Endowments Department at a cost of ₹50 lakh

title: Three injured after van overturns in Vellore
content: Based on an alert, Vellore North police rescued injured persons, who were admitted at Government Medical College Hospital in Vellore.

title: Kerala to approach courts if Bills are kept pending with Governor, President beyond ‘reasonable time’
content: In response to a Presidential Reference, the Supreme Court had indicated that only a limited judicial review was possible on Bills pending beyond reasonable time. The State government may have to be clear on when to initiate legal action as the SC did not elaborate on the ‘reasonable time’

title: CPI(M) local secretary accused of threatening candidate
content: A former area secretary of the party, contesting as Independent, says he was threatened by the party’s local secretary

title: Vizhinjam to play role in Kerala’s green hydrogen initiative
content: Plans afoot for regional green hydrogen ecosystem, with Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram as hubs, under the Hydrogen Valley Innovation Cluster (HVIC) initiative

title: Political fronts keen to boost panchayat tally in Ernakulam to win perception battle
content: Fronts in Ernakulam are counting on every institution to secure a win and shape a broader political narrative ahead of the upcoming Assembly elections

title: Election Commission of India officials to begin review of SIR work in T.N. from November 24
content: P. Pawan, Deputy Director, and Devansh Tiwari from the Media Division, EC, will visit Chennai between November 24 and 26 to review media coordination and voter awareness activities of SIR Phase-II

title: J&K L-G chairs security review meeting in Jammu amid crackdown
content: An official spokesman said the Lieutenant Governor congratulated the Jammu and Kashmir Police for its meticulous investigation and quick response in dismantling the pan-India terror network

title: ‘Vilayath Buddha’ movie review: Mass masala aspirations bring down a film with compelling core
content: Writer GR Indugopan, along with co-screenwriter Rajesh Pinnadan, banks more on the massy side of things, much of which are familiar recreations from umpteen films of the genre

title: BJP objects to Muslim intake in Vaishno Devi Medical College, stirs row
content: BJP, VHP and Bajrang Dal have objected to admissions of students from Kashmir to mata Vaishno Devi Medical College in Katra . the college filled seats strictly on NEET’s merit list and reserved 85% of its seats for J&K domiciles . only eight Hindu students from Jammu made it to the first batch of 50 .

title: 2nd 'key witness' identifies Yasin Malik as 'main shooter' in 1990 IAF killings
content: a second "key eyewitness" has identified in court jailed Kashmiri separatist Yasin Malik as the "main shooter" in the 1990 terrorist attack in which four unarmed IAF personnel were killed and 22 others wounded . the unnamed witness's testimony comes 22 months after a retired colleague of the victims first identified him as the main armed assailant .

title: Salute, tears mark Tejas pilot Syal's final journey in Kangra
content: family members, relatives, officials, and hundreds of locals bid an emotional farewell to the 34-year-old IAF officer . the funeral pyre was lit by Syal's cousin . Earlier, the mortal remains of Wing Commander Syal were brought from Dubai on board India Air Force's C130 aircraft .

title: 'Creamy layer' cornering big share of jobs quota: CJI Gavai
content: CJI Bhushan Ramakrishna Gavai said it is worrisome that caste is being weaponised by the socially and economically uplifted among SC/ST communities to corner a major portion of reservation in jobs . the second from Dalit community to head the judiciary, says it is for Parliament to debate and legislate new norms and mechanisms to curb the phenomenon .

title: NFL Week 12's fashionable arrivals, featuring Bucs QB Baker Mayfield
content: week 12 of the season delivered another wave of pregame tunnel looks that matched the stakes on the field . from understated tunnel walks to full-on runway moments, Week 12 delivered a wave of tunnel looks . the last week of football action before Thanksgiving means that November football is in full swing .

title: No double standards in global terror fight: PM Modi at G20
content: PM Modi joined the trilateral mechanism meet hosted by south african president Cyril Ramaphosa and attended also by brazilian president Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva . all three countries have had their share of problems with the US under Trump, diplomatic sources played down suggestions that the meeting was a response to the americans .

title: Justice Surya Kant takes oath as CJI; to hold office for nearly 15 months
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: MLB offseason grades: Judging the Nimmo-for-Semien swap for Mets, Rangers
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Where the most chaos could be lurking on Rivalry Week
content: the penultimate week of the college football regular season gave us plenty of entertainment . we got an incredible comeback in Salt Lake City, we got some resounding blowouts and we got the best ending of the season at the Division II level . the ACC gave us more chaos thanks to Georgia Tech's no-show against Pitt .

title: 🏈 Projecting the College Football Playoff top 12
content: the Sooners beat the Tigers 17-6 in Norman . there wasn't any movement in this week's top 12 projection . a dominant win against a now sub.-500 team isn't going to change the way the committee views Ohio State as the most complete team in the country .

title: A year after Ruben Amorim's Man Utd debut, things are finally turning
content: Ruben Amorim arrived at carrington for the first time last season . he agreed to leave Sporting CP halfway through . the majority of his squad were away playing for their countries . it was a cold international break when he arrived at the club .

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 12: Is the J.J. McCarthy era already coming to an end?
content: the Minnesota Vikings are a good organization, and they made the decision to go all-in on quarterback J.J. McCarthy and ... well... it just has to get better one of these weeks, right? not this week . the Vikings have offensive line issues .

title: Hurts: Meltdown needs to 'light a fire' in Eagles
content: Eagles QB Jalen Hurts and wide receiver DeVonta Smith sat side-by-side at their locker stalls . the media entered after a 24-21 loss to the Dallas Cowboys in week 12 . "we've got to own this one, let it light a fire in us as a team," he said .
